definition: grain that has begun to ripen/variant of 衹|只[zhi3]
classifier for birds and certain animals, one of a pair, some utensils, vessels etc
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: Hey you, out there on your own, Sitting naked by the phone.
sentences.chinese: 喂，那个独自一人，只身坐在电话旁的你。

sentences.english: It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune must be in want of a wife.
sentences.chinese: 有钱的只身总要娶位太太，这是全球公认的真理。

sentences.english: Don't fight not gentleness don't eosinophilic alcohol and tobacco, single good woman alone.
sentences.chinese: 不倾城不温柔不嗜烟酒，单身只身好女人。

sentences.english: Better never to have met you in my dream than to wake and reach for hands that are not there.
sentences.chinese: 我宁愿在梦中从没遇见过你，也好过醒后只身一人。

sentences.english: She had a quarrel with the pimp and she went alone to Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 在死之前，她和老鸨吵了一架，后只身到了香港。

sentences.english: The Apaches by now realized that I was alone and quickly began to follow.
sentences.chinese: 当那些印第安人发现我只身一人时，便很快追了上来。

sentences.english: To rescue old housekeeper and the return of the crisis to return to France alone.
sentences.chinese: 为了搭救老管家而只身回到险象环生的法国。

sentences.english: Starscream's ghost awakens and heads to Tryptic.
sentences.chinese: 红蜘蛛之鬼魂苏醒，只身前往铁甲星。

sentences.english: She was really quite alone in the world.
But he does feel almost left alone;
sentences.chinese: 但是，他的确觉得自己是只身一人。

sentences.english: Only one came to other country and speak English. Just our example.
sentences.chinese: 只身一人来到中国，用英语交流，正是我们的榜样。

sentences.english: Many Geese return home without their jewelry or computers, but return home.
sentences.chinese: 许多“嫖客”都是损失了珠宝或电脑而只身回到家中。

sentences.english: He captured a lion unaided by anyone.
The U.S. can't go in and accomplish the mission alone.
sentences.chinese: 美国不会只身参与并达成任务。

sentences.english: Alone a person occasionally thought of in the night that, did not have the former days missing actually.
sentences.chinese: 只身一人在夜深临时牵记，却没有了昔时的顾虑。

sentences.english: Bessie died, she had a quarrel with the pimp and she want alone to Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 在死之前，她和老鸨吵了一架，后只身到了香港。

definition: to leave home to make one's way in the world/to leave the life one knows to seek success
to seek knowledge/to study/to attend college
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
lit. single spear and horse (idiom); fig. single-handed/unaccompanied
foreign lands and places (idiom); living as expatriate
